required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I, Healthy Subject, Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Study of an M1 Agonist to Treat Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single and Multiple Oral Dose, Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of HTL0009936 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in young and elderly healthy volunteers of HTL9936, a selective M1 receptor agonist intended for the treatment of cognitive disorders.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in young and elderly healthy volunteers of HTL9936, a selective M1 receptor agonist intended for the treatment of cognitive disorders. This study is a single ascending dose study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse Events, as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing of informed consent up to 30 days after the final visit
primary_outcome.description: AE reports include a description of the AE, date and time of onset and resolution, intensity, and relationship to IMP.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Safety Lab parameters as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day-1, at select dosing days, and at 5 to 7 days post dose for single doseand 15 to 17 days post first dose in multiple dosing.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in vital signs as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day-1, at select dosing days and at 5 to 7 days post dose for single dose, and 15 to 17 days post first dose in multiple dosing.
primary_outcome.description: Pulse rate,body temperature,blood pressure, and orthostatic changes.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in 12-lead electrocardiograms as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, pre-dose, at select dosing days and at 5 to 7 days post dose for single dose,and 15 to 17 days post first dose in multiple dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic measures in plasma as measured by Peak plasma concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, multiple time points to 24h, at select dosing days, and 5 to 7 days post dosefor single dose,and 15 to 17 days post first dose in multiple dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration (Cmax), time at occurrence of Cmax (tmax), Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) 0-t, 0- infinity, percent of AUC 0-infinity, Cmax normalized by dose, AUC 0-t normalized for dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic measures in cerebro spinal fluid (CSF) in young males as measured by max observed CSF (Cmax CSF)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed CSF concentration (Cmax CSF), area under the CSF concentration versus time

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic measures to assess the food effect as measured by ANOVA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, multiple time points to 24h, and at 12h, 24h and 5 to 7 days post dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Food effect analysis will be based on analysis of variance (ANOVA) for treatment differences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic response as measured by pupillometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points Day1 to 6h post dose Part 1 only.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in average pupil diameter as measured in 3 different conditions of lux.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic measures in urine in young males and elderly male and female subjects as measured by amount of urine excreted at collection intervals
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose,multiple 4h collection intervals to 24h post dose on select dosing days to Day 10 for multiple dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Amount excreted in urine at each collection interval (Ae1-t2) all parts. Cumulative amount excreted to 12h and 24h (Ae0-t) depending on Part. Cumulative urine excreted of unchanged drug to 24h (Fe%) and to 12h depending on Part. Volume of urine collected during each collection interval (Vur), and renal clearance (CLr) all parts

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic response as measured by Bond and Lader visual analogue scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at multiple timepoints to 24h post dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in 3 factor scores (Alertness, Contentedness and Calmness) which will be derived from the individual VAS scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic response as measured by changes in qEEG and Event Related Potentials (ERP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day-1, Day 4, Day 9 multiple dosing regimen only
secondary_outcome.description: qEEg and ERP (P50 sensory gating, Mismatch Negativity and P300)

arm_group.description: HTL0009936 single and multiple ascending oral doses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index of ≥19 and ≤ 30kg/m²
- Healthy subject free from any clinically significant illness or disease
- Female subjects must be ≥65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who is predicted to be a CYP2D6 poor or ultra rapid metabolizer
- History of hypersensitivity to study drug
- History of epilepsy or seizures
- Subject with previous history of suicidal behavior
- Subjects with significant hearing impairment
- Subjects with an abnormal EEG
